questionList.solution: `a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=1`, so `x=0`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=10`, so `x=1`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=100`, so `x=2`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=1000`, so `x=3`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=10000`, so `x=4`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=100000`, so `x=5`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=1000000`, so `x=6`.
`a^x=b` rewritten as a log is `log_a b = x`. Therefore, `10^x=10000000`, so `x=7`.
